oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Barnyard Collection: Geese
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Woodcuts (prints);
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: One color half sheet (black on white) depicting geese. Poster is one in a set. Depression-Era technical schools used this series of barnyard animals to teach students the craft of woodcarving. The woodblocks were originally designed by Clyde Clack of Dallas, Texas, who sold the copyright to Hatch Show Print in 1933.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Clyde Clack
